edu.rit.numeric

Class XYZSeries.Fit

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.numeric.XYZSeries.Fit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Function
    Enclosing class:
    XYZSeries

    public static class XYZSeries.Fit
extends java.lang.Object
implements Function
    Class XYZSeries.Fit holds the results of a least squares fit of an XYZSeries to a model that is a linear combination of basis functions. The x and y values are the data points; each z value is the standard deviation of the measurement error in the corresponding y value, assuming the measurement error distribution is a zero-mean Gaussian. A Fit object is also a Function that can be used to evaluate the fitted model y = Σi (ai ⋅ Fi(x)).
    See Also:
    XYZSeries.linearFit(Function[])

    • Field Detail

      • M

        public final int M
        Number of basis functions.

      • funcs

        public final Function[] funcs
        Array of basis functions Fi(x).

        Note: Do not alter the contents of the funcs array.

      • a

        public final double[] a
        Array of basis function coefficients ai.

        Note: Do not alter the contents of the a array.

      • covar

        public final double[][] covar
        Covariance matrix. This is an M×M matrix. The diagonal elements are the variances of the basis function coefficients. The off-diagonal elements are the covariances of the pairs of basis function coefficients.

        Note: Do not alter the contents of the covar matrix.

      • chi2

        public final double chi2
        Chi-square merit function of the fit between the model (this Fit object) and the data (original XYZSeries object).

      • significance

        public final double significance
        Significance of χ2.
